DOC.brief_summary: The investigator propose randomize control trial base Social Networks Activity ( SNAP ) Model evaluate : ( 1 ) effectiveness internet-based fitness walk program deliver patient risk factor cardiovascular disease stroke ; ( 2 ) contribution social support network enhance effectiveness internet-based fitness walk program . The investigator recruit 308 patient sedentary risk factor cardiovascular disease randomly assign one follow group : 1 . Internet-based fitness walk program ( WalkLink ) ; 2 . Internet-based fitness walk program plus additional social network intervention ( WalkLink+ ) ; 3 . Minimal treatment control . The primary specific aim study : 1 . Evaluate effect WalkLink WalkLink+ relative minimal treatment control group change : physical activity , aerobic fitness , blood pressure , body composition , body mass index ( BMI ) , baseline posttest , 6-month follow-up . 2 . Compare differential effectiveness WalkLink+ WalkLink change : physical activity , aerobic fitness , blood pressure , body composition BMI baseline posttest , 6-month follow-up . 3 . Evaluate mediator moderator effect select individual-level self-management skill ( goal setting , planning , self-monitoring ) , social support variable ( number activity partner , social cue walk , social praise/reinforcement ) , physical-ecological variable ( neighborhood walkability , physical cue walk ) WalkLink WalkLink+ treatment outcome .
DOC.criteria: Sedentary , define less 150 minute per week moderate intensity activity Between age 35 64 Able speak English Able provide inform consent Able participate moderateintensity physical activity ( e.g. , moderate pace walk ) No access home private work computer Internet access Body mass index ( BMI ) great 39.9 Systolic blood pressure > 160 mm Hg diastolic blood pressure > 100 mm Hg Bone , joint , foot problem interfere walk Diabetes , pulmonary , cardiovascular disease Consume 5 drink alcohol day Currently pregnant Not live within preselected study neighborhood plan move local area study period
